Package com.egehurturk.core

Class BaseServer

java.lang.Object
com.egehurturk.core.BaseServer
Direct Known Subclasses:
HttpServer, TCPServer
public abstract class BaseServer
extends java.lang.Object
Base Server for providing TCP/IPv4 Socket connection. Uses TCP as 4th layer defined in OSI for a server-client based server

Simply creates a @code{ServerSocket} class for the base Server socket. Configured via these fields:

  • Server port
  • Server host
  • Backlog

In general, each connection request made of a client is accepted by ServerSocket. Inner class BaseServer.ConnectionManager handles the connection. Uses BufferedReader and PrintWriter for communicating with sockets. InputStream and OutputStream are received by the socket itself, and then passed into BufferedReader and PrintWriter.

See Also:
HttpServer

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    static class  BaseServer.ConnectionManager
    Manager class for handling Socket object client.

  • Field Details

    • server

      protected java.net.ServerSocket server
      The server socket that client connects. Configured with serverPort, serverHost, and backlog.

      Pass in configurations in the constructor of the subclass. Configurations should be managed by properties file later on.

    • serverPort

      protected int serverPort
      Server port that the server socket is attached on. Client connects to this port whatever the IP adress is.

    • serverHost

      protected java.net.InetAddress serverHost
      Server host that the server is running on. For now, it is localhost. This can be changed in later versions

    • backlog

      protected int backlog
      The number of pending connections the queue will hold. More formally, the queued connection during the TCP handshake.

      This class handles requests by a blocking accept() method. This results in requests being queued by the server.

    • name

      protected java.lang.String name
      Server name that is used in HttpServer class in HTTP Protocol headers. Although usage is not limited for HTTP, any child class that inherits this class should have a name to run the server. Look for q.txt file for future usages of the servers

    • webRoot

      protected java.lang.String webRoot
      Web Root that HTML files live in. This is a directory that is the base URL. This directory will be considered and used as a directory and BaseServer.ConnectionManager will look for the path in this directory E.g. root_dir |- www | - index.html |- src | main ... When a path is requested, e.g localhost:9090/index.html, BaseServer.ConnectionManager will look in www/index.html. Note that the webRoot should be an outer directory which does not live in src file. The standard directory structure includes that "www" specifies the root/www, ./src/main/www specifies a directory inside the src/main directory.

    • debugMode

      protected boolean debugMode
      Debug mode to log [debug] level messages to console If this is enabled (i.e. debug=true) in properties configuration file, more verbose output will be logged to console.

    • in

      protected java.io.BufferedReader in
      The main reader that reads the client's socket output. Stream is buffered as to provide efficient reading of

      This will be used for reading HTTP requests for clients that are connected to the server

      Achieved with the client Socket connection's InputStream.

    • out

      protected java.io.PrintWriter out
      The main writer that writes for clients socket input. This will be used for writing HTTP responses for clients that are connected to the server.

    • META

      protected static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> META
      Meta information for logging, generating reports, server maintenance. Values are stored in HashMap as String, Object. Example usage: {"Max Connected Clients": 4}; In later versions, another class MetaModel can be created to store metadata

    • logger

      protected static org.apache.logging.log4j.Logger logger
      Logger interface for logging messages Initialized to null defaultly, override the value in subclasses, this can cause NullPointerException

    • context

      protected static org.apache.logging.log4j.core.LoggerContext context
      Required for configurating logger field with the log4j2.xml file

    • config

      protected java.util.Properties config
      Config properties imported from .properties file. Stored as Properties

    • CONFIG_PROP_FILE

      protected static java.lang.String CONFIG_PROP_FILE
      Properties file name

    • PORT_PROP

      protected static java.lang.String PORT_PROP
      Properties config places

    • HOST_PROP

      protected static java.lang.String HOST_PROP

    • NAME_PROP

      protected static java.lang.String NAME_PROP

    • WEBROOT_PROP

      protected static java.lang.String WEBROOT_PROP

    • DEBUG_PROP

      protected static java.lang.String DEBUG_PROP

    • propertiesStream

      protected java.io.InputStream propertiesStream
      File location of .properties file located in InputStream to perform IO operations (specifically reading the properties file) on the data.

      All of the settings are required in the properties file, located in the resources directory in the standard Maven project DIR.

  • Constructor Details

    • BaseServer

      public BaseServer​(int serverPort) throws java.net.UnknownHostException
      Chained constructor for intializing with only port. Passes default values for other arguments in the base constructor
      Parameters:
      serverPort - - Server port for configuration
      Throws:
      java.net.UnknownHostException - - Required for .getLocalHost().

    • BaseServer

      public BaseServer()
      Default constructor for BaseServer Does nothing. Used for configuring from an external properties file

    • BaseServer

      public BaseServer​(int serverPort, java.net.InetAddress serverHost, int backlog, java.lang.String name, java.lang.String webRoot, boolean debugMode)
      Base constructor that has all fields as arguments. Is used for manually configuring fields (Port, host, backlog). Checks for valid port, backlog.
      Parameters:
      serverPort - - Server port that ServerSocket listens on
      serverHost - - Server host that ServerSocket operates in ("localhost")
      backlog - - Number of pending requests in the queue
      name - - Name of the server for running or stopping from CL
      webRoot - - Web Root of the server for URL processing
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - Throws for value of port that is out of range, described below

    • start

      public abstract void start() throws java.io.IOException
      Accept any client that is connected to the BaseServer ServerSocket by calling the ServerSocket.accept() method. Socket client = server.accept();

      Passes this client object to the BaseServer.ConnectionManager class that handles the loop, input, and output of socket comminucation.

      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - - IOException due to client acceptance
      See Also:
      BaseServer.ConnectionManager

    • stop

      public abstract void stop() throws java.io.IOException
      Closes the socket channels for both ServerSocket object of server and Socket object for client. This method should be called if the server is going to be closed. HttpServer server = new HttpServer(...); try { server.close() } catch (IOException e) { e.printStackTrace(); }
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - - IOException due to closing of the client and server

    • restart

      public abstract void restart()
      Restarts the server. Not sure if it is needed

    • reload

      public abstract void reload()
      Restarts the server. Not sure if it is needed

    • configureServer

      public void configureServer() throws ConfigurationException
      Configures the server by the default properties file which is "server.properties" Note for future: - You have a constructor to configure, and this method to configure. Decide which one to use.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - where the web root directory is not correct
      ConfigurationException

    • configureServer

      public void configureServer​(java.lang.String propertiesFilePath) throws ConfigurationException
      Configures the server via the property file name passed in as argument. This method is equal to setting the CONFIG_PROP_FILE with the setConfigPropFile(String) method.
      Parameters:
      propertiesFilePath - - Property file name (path)
      Throws:
      ConfigurationException

    • serveConfigurations

      protected java.util.Properties serveConfigurations​(java.util.Properties userConfig, java.io.InputStream file)
      Populates the necessary fields (or properties) from the source InputStream properties file, and the Properties user config. If the properties file is missing, throws an IOException error.
      Parameters:
      userConfig - - Properties file that has properties
      file - - InputStream file resource
      Returns:
      serverConfig - Properties new properties file

    • isDirectory

      protected boolean isDirectory​(java.lang.String dirPath)
      Check if a directory exists in the file structure. Essential for HttpServer for containing HTML files.
      Parameters:
      dirPath - - Directory path where static and public files live in. Default value is www. See BaseServer(int, InetAddress, int, String, String, boolean)
      Returns:
      boolean - returns true if a direcetory exists

    • createManager

      protected BaseServer.ConnectionManager createManager​(java.net.Socket cli)
      Creates a new BaseServer.ConnectionManager class. Acts as a factory method for the object, allows subclasses to change behavior of the inner class BaseServer.ConnectionManager.

      For extending the inner class, override this method to return the local inner class of that subclass.

      Parameters:
      cli - - Socket object client
      Returns:
      BaseServer.ConnectionManager - new object for ConnectionManager
